reviews.title: Time to relax
reviews.text: We stayed in the Indus room at Alam Shanti - where I could sit quietly on the balcony all day and be inspired by the situation. The room was lovely, clean and cool. Beds were very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great views, unobtrusive, friendly service, pool just right to cool down in. Food also good. Met some lovely people by the pool, some on their honeymoon - couldn't think of a nicer place to spend it. It was nice to meet a variety of international visitors who also seemed to be enjoying themselves thoroughly. We're going back so I can spend more time drawing.
reviews.title: wonderful calm oasis

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we could not have been made more welcome. we had a 10 night stay for our honeymoon and we were looking for peace and quiet, beautiful surroundings, excelent room and service. We found all of this in the traditional Balinese style hotel.
reviews.title: This place is a true Gem

likes.disliked: — Bugs in the bathroom at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds were lovely with flowers everywhere, the room (Gangaa) is huge with a fantastic view from the large veranda which sported a lovely day bed for relaxing.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay

likes.liked: — Peaceful, beautiful, free shuttle, free breakfast, great price

reviews.text: If we wanted drinks or food at any time during the day, all we had to do was ring reception and they would get anything we wanted delivered to the room or the pool.
reviews.title: we loved Alam Shanti

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: one of the best accomodation ever!!!!! nice and friendly staff, good breakfast, and dinner delivered from nearby restaurant ! just best place and not so expensive !!!!!!!!
reviews.title: beautiful and stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was wooowww when I first arrived at Alam Shanti.... It's so amazing!!!! I really love my room... big, quiet, clean, and sooo relaxing!!! I stayed for 2 days with my boyfriend... we stayed in Narmada room which is the 2nd best room in Alam Shanti... it has its own kitchen!!! what a lovely place to relax... :) Lovely place with lovely staff... very recommended!!! u won't regret the money u spent for this lovely hotel... :)
reviews.title: Perfect Private Holiday ....
The best memories
reviews.text: Excellent place, quiet, fantastic service, beautiful nature, cosy rooms with small details that makes you happy. I would love to go back!

Upon check-in we were welcomed with a cold drink and shown to our rooms. We had two rooms in the same building; one was to sleep 2 adults and one 3; however there was some confusion in room placement as the staff weren't aware that a 5th person had been added to the booking - the booking was originally for 4 adults, but was changed to 5 adults a few weeks before our arrival via. email.
reviews.title: Beautiful & Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were told the downstairs room was for 3 adults and upstairs was for 2; but this was wrong because the upstairs room had 2 double beds and the downstairs one only a chaise longe - which was turned into a bed. The matter got resolved but it was still an annoyance because the make shift bed wasn't very comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place To Stay - You Won't Be Disappointed!

reviews.text: This is really a gem, very quiet and hidden away in the rice fields.
reviews.title: Like a palace

likes.liked: — Very luxurious accommodation in a quiet, tranquil place. Lots of privacy.
likes.disliked: — There was nothing we didn't like

reviews.text: Before I start, if anyone has any questions about the Laksmi and Saraswati rooms - feel free to ask, only too happy to help out.
reviews.title: Paradise - plants and wildlife everywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Garden House – had Laksmi and Saraswati rooms. Our sensible 11 yo stayed in Laksmi on the ground floor; security is really good here, so no worries. It’s located in a small village called Nyuhkuning (Nee UH Kun Ing) so very few passers-by. Quiet, beautiful and discreetly run. Had to book a year in advance to get the whole house for five nights. For the price both rooms are sensational. Some folk have complained the Laksmi is a dreadful room, but no complaints here; plenty of room with a nice huge bathroom. It’s hand held showers in both rooms, and the latticing above the windows has no glass, so mozzies are present but mozzie nets around the beds efficient and the Saraswati has a day bed with mozzie nets and reading lights, so that became our reading area at dusk.
reviews.title: A place with soul

reviews.text: Free shuttle absolutely fabulous, although how long it takes for them to get to you is seriously dependant on the traffic in town which can be hellish especially during the day. Alternatively you can walk into town via a moped alley at the bottom of Monkey Forest Road 10 minutes, but it is unlit with regular moped traffic. Don’t forget to ask for your free of charge afternoon tea, plenty of folk either forgot or didn’t know about it. No sign of any monkeys, in the resort or in town; other years (2008 & 2006) they were everywhere; I know the island has a serious rabies problem but was only aware of the culling of unlicensed dogs.
reviews.title: Gangga or Yamuna which is the best room?
Relaxing holiday
reviews.text: This is not a five star resort and nor should it be. The wildlife and insects are also guests, and yes the frog watching me do my yoga on the huge balcony was distracting, but wonderful at the same time.
Most of the other info I could give you is written in other reviews. Happy to answer any questions anyone has; just message me.
reviews.title: Pretty awesome stay (if you are not afraid of geckos)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four nights in the Gangga room at Alam Shanti in late September. We were absolutely delighted with the room, the hotel’s peaceful location, the lovely gardens and the friendly and gracious staff. The Gangga room was gorgeous and the spacious and beautifully furnished verandah with its view of coconut palms and rice fields was amazing. We did not encounter any of the service problems noted by a recent poster who stayed in the same room.
reviews.title: A delightful and serene hotel

likes.disliked: — The towels could be a bit larger and thicker but they were quite servicable

reviews.title: No! No! No!
reviews.text: All of our breakfasts were delicious. I was particularly fond of the banana pancake which was actually a crepe with thinly sliced bananas and freshly grated coconut. We also enjoyed complementary afternoon tea and cake on our verandah each afternoon and used Alam Shanti's complementary transportation back to our hotel every evening after walking through the Monkey Forest to dinner in Ubud.
Given its many assets and its modest room rates we think Alam Shanti is a world class bargain and recommend it without hesitation to anyone looking for a unique hotel with a true Balinese flavor.
reviews.title: A marvel

reviews.text: I really can't expand on the glowing comments already previously submitted - this place truly deserves them. We had the cheapest of the villas, The Garden House, which consists of Saraswati upstairs and Laksmi downstairs. Good value at 75.00 USD per night per apartment plus 15% tax. This includes a very generous breakfast served at your convenience between 7-10am and afternoon tea, served between 3-6pm. We had 5 people in our group so this was incredibly good value, factor in the free shuttle bus in to Ubud town and it was probably the best all-round value for money accommodation I've ever stayed in. I actually preferred the ambiance and rooms at the Alam Shanti to the 5 star lodge at the Elephant Safari Park. We had no problem with wi-fi, it worked for the duration of our stay. Lots of lovely gardens and birdlife..we also saw fireflies and squirrels. Monkeys are not a problem here. You can order in dinner from local restaurant Laka Leke and the staff will plate it up for you on your veranda. Lovely clean pool. Truly a peaceful haven to unwind in - the staff are very kind gentle people who will be happy to help you to enjoy your holiday anyway they can. Air-con was very efficient, beds are very comfortable and well-netted. Staff light mozzie coils at dusk and these were not a problem at all. You will get the odd gecko visit your room but they stay up high near the ceiling and are completely harmless and quite cute and deter the mozzies which beat the coils. If you are considering the Alam Shanti.......don't hesitate to book.
reviews.title: Believe the hype - this is a special place (The Garden House).

reviews.text: Please message me if you need further information.
reviews.title: "an oasis of tranquility"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a four night stay here in the Garden House, occupying both apartments. Upstairs is Saraswati and downstairs Laksmi. There is a shared kitchen if needed. Both apartments are spacious and clean. The bathrooms are big with lots of natural light and lovely toiletries. Our beds were comfortable and like cocoons with the mosquito nets drawn round. Complimentary fruit baskets and complimentary breakfast each day. The breakfast was beautiful and served on our balcony with everything laid out properly. A choice of Jaffles, banana pancakes, eggs, toast, croissants, muesli and fruit, juice, tea/coffee etc. (I have left a few things out but it gives you an idea). Loved the village of Nyuhkuning and easy to walk around with little shops and eateries on the same road as Alam Shanti. Monkey forest is at the end of the road and you can walk through to the shops of Ubud, 15 mins or so. Very entertaining and not for the faint hearted!! We loved it though and the monkeys are such characters. We ate at Cafe Wayan in Ubud which is owned by the same family that own Alam Shanti. A beautiful meal in a pretty tranquil setting with great service. They also have a bakery at the entrance to the restaurant. The hotel shuttle will drop you off and also pick you up. We also went to their other restaurant which is walking distance from the hotel, Laka Leke and had another great meal and thoroughly enjoyed the kecak and fire dance show. The grounds at Alam Shanti are well kept and very lush and pretty. We swam every day and twice had lunch by the pool. The food comes from Laka Leke and i am still craving the guacamole and spicy chicken wings! There is complimentary afternoon tea either at your room or by the pool. The staff are fantastic and so helpful but not intrusive. We had a one hour massage at Alam Wangi Spa and also a pedicure. A lovely peaceful experience in a nice environment. The whole experience at Alam Shanti is one of peace and tranquility. It is very quiet and well set back from the road. It is wonderful value for money and a really lovely place and a great location. We cannot wait to go back.
reviews.title: Doesn't get any better than that!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights at the Shindu room with my husband in May 2012. Room (although one of the smallest on the property) was more than big enough for two. It is wonderfully decorated, awesome surroundings, great indor-outdoor flow and very private. The open bathroom was the best - small pond and a garden with a nice water feature, fish in the pond and lillies and orchinds all around. It was simply magical.
reviews.title: Alone with nature

reviews.text: I had a look at two other rooms - Dewi and Indus. Although all the rooms on the property are wonderful, I didn't like Dewi and Indus as much as I liked Shindu. Dewi and Indus are on the upper level, so they don't have the traditional open bathrooms. Also, their balconies create a rather confined feeling. We preferred the verandah on the ground level as it merges with the garden and makes everything more spacious (though less private compared to the upper level balcony).
reviews.title: Another 5 star review!

reviews.text: Just returned from Alam Shanti and Alam Giwa their sister property next door. Both were magical places which embodied my vision of Bali. Stayed on the rice paddie replete with Oxen, ducks, monitor lizards, gekos and a myriqad of sights and smells. the hotel had a centries old feel and design yet is 3! New spa was great with daily $20 1.5 hour massages from qualified technicians. Breakfast crepes were killer and the staff arranged all tours, transpo and my picky needs with ease..... Go stay there ASAP!!!!
reviews.title: A magical place!!

reviews.text: This place was just amazing. Alam Shanti has 8 rooms (ranging in price) so I'd recommend to book early. I stayed for three nights. One night in the Narmada room, and the following two nights upstairs in Indus. Both rooms were lovely, with four poster bed and marble (huge!) bathrooms. The upstairs room has a balcony with daybed, and the downstairs room a huge verhandah. The pool area was nice, clean, quiet and overlooked a nearby creek and rice field. I can also recommend the spa at the property, they did nice massage, facial, pedicure and manicure.
reviews.title: Wow!!

reviews.text: As a couple of reviews mention you are living close with nature. That means the occasional bug or cicak (house gecko) coming inside to pay a visit - they do no harm and add to the ambience of the place.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room did occasionaly get a bit smokey courtesy of the neighbouring farmers maintaining their rice paddly fields and burning off. A simple fix for this is just to close the windows when they light up.
reviews.title: What a find!

likes.liked: — Comfort of rooms, and amazing setting.

reviews.text: It is a nice walk into Ubud via the sacred Monkey Forest, the hotel also has a free shuttle service if you're feeling too lazy (or hot) to walk.
reviews.title: Wonderful ambiance, huge rooms

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this place for those wanting time to relax. Part of the attraction is that it is further out of town (15 minutes walk or free shuttles). We took our two kids there (girls; 8 and 10) and found we had plenty to do for three days. The rooms are awesome with own kitchens and out door furniture and plenty of space. Complimentary breakfast was also great.
reviews.title: very peaceful great value for money

reviews.text: We arrived with very high expectations, and yet somehow Alam Shanti exceeded them - a stunning and serene paradise. We stayed in Yamuna, and while more expensive than other villas, it was worth every cent. The main room was big enough for a family of four, and the attention to detail of the villa from design to fit-out was extraordinary. Even slept a night on the day bed listening to the rain and night-time animal & insect noises. The private infinity pool (for Yamuna and Gangga guests) overlooks a river and rice fields, as does the huge balcony. When not swimming, eating or snoozing we watched the butterflies and dragonflies, looked for lizards and watched the squirrels jumping from tree to tree. It's only a 10-15 minute walk through Monkey Forest to Ubud, or use the free on-demand shuttle. We ordered dinner from one of the nearby restaurants on a couple of nights and the Alam Shanti staff would 'plate up' the food and serve it on our balcony. Only minor suggestion would be to ease up a little bit on the pool chlorine. Overall, this was the perfect place to unwind with the kids.
reviews.title: Beyond expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Huge, luxurious room. Indulgent shower. Good therapists at the spa: reflexology and massage were pleasantly strong. Room-service breakfasts were lovely. Lush grounds and landscaping. Quiet pool area, where you can have afternoon tea served to you.
reviews.title: Pricey but fantastically beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected the Alam Shanti due to the reviews on here, and we weren't dissappointed. When selecting an area to base ourselves, Ubud seemed to be a good choice. We wanted to get a good taste of Bali, rather than a beach location which could probably be anywhere in the world. As already stated breakfast is ordered the night before and is delivered to your balacony at the time you specify in the morning, highly recommend the ginger tea. Afternoon tea was a nice touch aswell, we enjoyed this one afternoon when just enjoying a day of sheer relaxation, I believe this is served between 3-6.
reviews.title: so peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are all very friendly and helpful, we had a couple of different treatments in the spa while we were there, one of the couples packages was a real luxury and highly recommended, followed by a refreshing dip in the pool watching all the wildlife. Our holiday was just before the nyepi festival which was great to see.
reviews.title: Secluded, quiet and beautiful

reviews.text: Not entirely sure what sets this hotel apart from the others.There is an indescribable vibe about Alam Shanti, that is hard to encapsulate in mere words. Needless to say it is very popular,so book well ahead.Loved this place so much we have already booked for next year; I must say that after many trips to Bali spanning 25 years, Alam Shanti has rekindled my love affair with this magical island.
reviews.title: A great, if not one of the best hotels ever
